newsitem.title: USA: North Dakota to receive $201 million in flood aid.
newsitem.headline: North Dakota to receive $201 million in flood aid.

text.p: The federal government said on Wednesday it will provide $201 million to North Dakota for recovery from this year's spring flooding, most of it going to heavily hit Grand Forks.

Housing and Urban Development Secretary Andrew Cuomo told a news conference that $171 million of the total goes to Grand Forks. It is the largest single grant of its type ever released by his department.
The money can be used for long-term recovery efforts, property buyouts, rehabilitation of dwellings and flood prevention efforts.

Grand Forks was swamped by the Red River of the North in April when a heavy winter snowpack thawed and a levee system failed. Most of the town was evacuated and part of the business district burned during the height of the flooding.
